metadata.title: For Sale: 1957 Chevrolet 210 Post Bel Air

sections: This beefed up 210 is from an iconic era.
Owned by the the current owner for 35 years,
2 door Post Sedan will hit you right in the Hollywood memories of Tony Danza's movie car in
. There's a whole lot more going on with

than meets the eye, and a lot of time, effort, and money were put into the build - the perfect trifecta for a well-built car. It's currently up for grabs from Corvette Mike Midwest, and it's definitely worth checking out.

The exterior is coated in a eye-catching yellow paint with professional pinstripping accents. It rolls on brilliant chrome 15-inch Cragar SS wheels, that are wrapped in BFG raised letter TAs with 215R/65/15 on the front and 235R/60/15 rear.
, you'll find a black interior with custom touches, like Autometer gauges, period correct bucket seats, custom dash, radio, column mounted Autometer tach, and Hurst 4-speed shifter.
, bored 0.030 over to 406 cubic-inches, and it makes 375-horspower. The engine is equipped with Pete Jackson timing gears, and is backed by a Muncie M-21 4 speed manual transmission.

Inside the engine bay, atop the engine, are performance upgrades that add to the clean engine compartment, like chrome valve covers and air cleaner, a aluminum 360 intake, a Holley double pumper built by the Carburetor Shop, with competition heads, breathing through Hedman hot jet coated headers, and Flowmaster triple chambered mufflers. The drivetrain feeds in to a 3:73 positraction rear end with traction bars, and gets stopping power from front disc brakes with rear drums.

Corvette Mike Midwest is always looking for Corvettes and Muscle Cars to buy or consign.  Corvette Mike will market your car nationally. If you have one vehicle, or a collection, please call Marty at 630-230-0441 or email
